name: delinquently
content:
delinquently adverb
(UNACCEPTABLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is illegal or not acceptable: The boys in the study behaved more delinquently than the girls, according to our measures of delinquent behaviour. There is greater pressure on them to behave delinquently because they have less opportunity to succeed by legitimate means.
More examplesFewer examplesSome adolescents who behave delinquently may also be more likely to commit criminal acts when they are adults.

delinquently adverb
(LATE)
US formal late, especially in paying money owed: Many firms were settling their bills late because their own customers were paying delinquently. She delinquently paid the taxes and incurred penalties.
More examplesFewer examplesHe delinquently filed several years’ worth of returns, reporting that he owed more than $1 million in unpaid taxes.
